column4: hey can anyone tell me what dhclient does? i have no earthly idea what its for.. but my girlfriend uses it to get her usb-wifi device working in edgy.... she claims someone told her to just run dhclient and it will magically fix everything... well it works.... but sometimes dhclient binds her to random ip's.... can someone explain what dhclient is .....
how does dhclient have the authority to assign an ip inside a router's network?
ok so basically she has more than one dhcp enabled router or pc assigning ip's.... (it's a network mess)
how can you make it force to a router
is there any way to force dhclient to look at one server?
Maybe we dont get what you are asking then..
dhclient will only work if you're already associated with an SSID.
Which sounds like she isnt.  `sudo iwconfig eth1 essid "essidname"`
Where eth1 is the name of the adapter
So, it would be `sudo iwconfig rausb0 essid "whateveryouressidis"`
You need to /join ##mac   This channel here is only for Ubuntu support.
